about.description:
HTTPie (pronounced aitch-tee-tee-pie) is a command line HTTP client. Its
goal is to make CLI interaction with web services as human-friendly as
possible. It provides a simple http command that allows for sending
arbitrary HTTP requests using a simple and natural syntax, and displays
colorized output. HTTPie can be used for testing, debugging, and generally
interacting with HTTP servers.
about.summary: a CLI, cURL-like tool for humans

name: httpie
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "httpie" %}
{% set version = "1.0.3" %}
{% set sha256 = "6d1b6e21da7d3ec030ae95536d4032c1129bdaf9de4adc72c596b87e5f646e80" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"
  entry_points:
    - http = httpie.__main__:main

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - colorama >=0.2.4  # [win]
    - pygments >=2.3.1
    - requests >=2.21.0

test:
  imports:
    - httpie
  commands:
    - http --help

about:
  home: https://httpie.org/
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'a CLI, cURL-like tool for humans'
  description: |
    HTTPie (pronounced aitch-tee-tee-pie) is a command line HTTP client. Its
    goal is to make CLI interaction with web services as human-friendly as
    possible. It provides a simple http command that allows for sending
    arbitrary HTTP requests using a simple and natural syntax, and displays
    colorized output. HTTPie can be used for testing, debugging, and generally
    interacting with HTTP servers.
  doc_url: https://httpie.org/doc
  dev_url: https://github.com/jakubroztocil/httpie

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - dougalsutherland
